title.narrative: Accountable grants for supporting DFID's partnership with China on international development, covering a range of sectors under the Millennium Development Goals.

description.narrative: This activity (Accountable grants for supporting DFID's partnership with China on international development, covering a range of sectors under the Millennium Development Goals.) is a component of International Development Support Project reported by FCDO, with a funding type of 'Not for profit organisation' and a budget of £7,106,445. This component benefits Developing countries, unspecified, and works in the following sector(s): Family planning, Water sector policy and administrative management, Public sector policy and administrative management, Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution, Trade policy and administrative management, Promotion of development awareness (non-sector allocable). , with the following implementing partners: British Council, Center for Global Development, Chatham House, China Agricultural University, Chinese Academy of International Trade and Economic Cooperation, Institute of Development Studies, Interagency Pain Research Coordinating Committee, International Institute for Sustainable Development, Overseas Development Institute, Peking University, Royal United Services Institute, Saferworld, School of Civil Engineering Tsinghua University, SDSN Association, Inc., South African Institute of International Affairs, WWF-UK. The start date is 01-01-2012 and the end date is 31-03-2022.

participating-org.narrative: Chinese Academy of International Trade and Economic Cooperation
School of Civil Engineering Tsinghua University
South African Institute of International Affairs

owner-org.narrative: UK - Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office (FCDO)

mailing-address.narrative: Public Enquiry Point, Abercrombie House, Eaglesham Road, East Kilbride, Glasgow G75 8EA

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
Public sector policy and administrative management
Water sector policy and administrative management

General Economic, Commercial and Labour Affairs - Economic Affairs - General Economic, Commercial and Labour Affairs - trade
Health - Social Affairs - Health - policy, planning and administration
Justice, Law and Order - Justice, Law, Order and Security - Justice, Law and Order - demobilisation
Water supply and Sanitation - Water, Natural Resource Management and Environment - Water supply and Sanitation - policy, planning and administration
Aggregated spend of less than £500 - Financial Year 2014 Quarter 4
